result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christa Sue Clark

records.addlTxt:
3:46 PM Defendant Christa Sue Clark appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Christa Sue Clark.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz has an offer recently; requests another status so he can discuss it with his client.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties. Atty Gumz waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
BY THE COURT:  Set for status.

3:23 PM Defendant Christa Sue Clark appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by phone for Christa Sue Clark.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz makes statement.
BY THE COURT:  Court will cancel warrant on the appearance today.
Atty Juech has no objection to the signature bond being reinstated.
BY THE COURT:  Court will reinstate the signature bond.
Status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Return on warrant on September 22, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:58 AM Defendant Christa Sue Clark not in court.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
Initial appearance on April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

03:28 PM Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christa Sue Clark appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is going to contact the PD Office.
  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.

Atty Juech requests a $500 cash bail with conditions.
Defendant can't afford a cash bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
  Initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
